page.title: 05POLEGATE COMMUNITY CENTRE
page.content:
IN 1960 PEOPLE GOT TOGETHER WITH THE IDEA OF BUILDING A HALL FOR THE PEOPLE OF POLEGATE. AFTER MUCH HARD WORK INVOLVING MANY PEOPLE, THE COMMUNITY CENTRE WAS OPENED IN 1969. SINCE THEN THERE HAVE BEEN TWO EXTENSIONS TO THE BUILDING. THE CENTRE IS OPEN EVERY DAY TO ALL AGES.
WEEKLY TIMETABLE: MONDAY-PLAYGROUP(3-5s),SENIOR CITIZENS TUESDAY-LUNCHEON CLUB,LADIES ORGANISTN WEDNESDAY-YOUTH CLUB,TABLE TENNIS THURSDAY-OLD TYME DANCE, DRAMA GROUP FRIDAY-SCOUTS, ORCHID SOCIETY SATURDAY-COFFEE MORNING,OTHER FUNCTION
THE MOST POPULAR ACTIVITY IS THE OLD TYME DANCING. THE COMMUNITY CENTRE WAS BUILT FOR THE USE OF THE PEOPLE OF POLEGATE AND IS CURRENTLY USED TO ITS FULL CAPACITY.
